data.title: Cole Porter Scholarship winners announced
data.meta_description: MIAMI COUNTY, IN- With Miami County the birthplace of the renowned musician Cole Porter, the family of Cole Porter has had a long-established scholarship granted to Miami County students. This scho…
data.text:
MIAMI COUNTY, IN- With Miami County the birthplace of the renowned musician Cole Porter, the family of Cole Porter has had a long-established scholarship granted to Miami County students. This scholarship was established in 1967 in memory of Cole Porter and his mother Kate Cole Porter. The funds for the scholarships have been provided by Cole’s cousins, the late Jules and Josephine Cole, the late James O. and Alice F. Cole, and Joey Cole Kubesch and her late husband Sidney J Kubesch.

This scholarship is awarded each year for any graduating senior from Miami County who will major in the fine arts, which includes all phases of music, fine and commercial art, performing art or teaching in any of these fields.

There are 2 scholarships awarded and are given for 4 years. The first is for $10,000 and the second for $7,500, are to be divided into 4 yearly payments for tuition and expenses.

This year in 2023, there were 5 applicants from Peru, Maconaquah and North Miami High Schools. The committee awarded this scholarship after a day of Auditions on Wednesday, April 26th.

The winner of the $10,000 scholarship was Kilynn Wallace of Maconaquah. The winner of the $7,500 scholarship was Aidyn Mathis of Peru. An alternate is always selected in case a student is unable to continue studies of a fine arts field. The alternate was Samantha Smith of North Miami.

For further information please contact Connie Cutler at cpscholarship2022@gmail.com or call 860-830-8259.
